long: Meaning: a "seat"; figuratively, a "site"; abstractly, a "session"; by extension an "abode" (the place or the time); by implication, "population".  Usage: assembly, dwell in, dwelling(-place), wherein (that) dwelt (in), inhabited place, seat, sitting, situation, sojourning.  Source: or "מֹשָׁב"; from "H3427";
